title: Nixon in the back of the bus cartoon - argument

content.question: Which of the following statements would best describe the point being made in the cartoon above about Richard Nixonâ€™s administration?

choices.label: In order for integration policies to work, Nixon needed to pick up the support of the silent majority.
The Nixon administration was arguing that integration was no longer a relevant policy.
Nixon was reversing progress toward integration made in the 1960s.
Nixon needed to attract more Black votes in order to move forward in civil rights.
Nixon supported busing as a means to integration.

content.answer: Nixon was reversing progress toward integration made in the 1960s.
